channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti, 29th December
item.description:
Graffiti

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riverpark Gardens, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Residents at Adam House dumping rubbish on the pavement, 29th December
item.description:
This is an ongoing problem that’s been reported to Bromley Council on numerous occasions with no improvement noticed. You can see who’s responsible for at least some of this rubbish. The litter blocks the pavement, is often hazardous, and encourages further littering behaviour. But above all, it’s not legal and needs enforcement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thesiger Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sanitation Crew not clearing bins., 29th December
item.description:
Sanitation crew purposefully leaving 2 out of 3 bins lids closed so that they do not have to empty all 3 bins. Means one bin over flows and people dump rubbish beside bin

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large quantity of rubbish in black plastic sacks dumped on the pavement outside 51 Nuxley Road Belvedere DA17., 29th December
item.description:

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 29th December
item.description:

item.title: Driver unloaded Christmas waste in to private bins., 29th December
item.description:

item.title: Branches growing in to the road and pavement, 29th December
item.description:
The branch had been growing for a while into the road and on the pavement. I cycle along the road. And it's a bit dangerous. Can it be cut back? It's a five minute job. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Larch Way, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish and leaf litter on the side of 95 Eglinton Road, 29th December
item.description:
There’s been bags of rubbish dumped in the corner in the alleyway on the side of 95 Eglinton Road. There’s also leaf litter on the stairs and it’s making the area very dirty. Can we get this cleaned up please?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eglinton Road, Woolwich

item.title: Paving and verge damaged by builders, 29th December
item.description:
This seems to be the same construction company that have destroyed the paving outside number 38, and are now in the process of doing the same outside the last house on the other side of the road meaning that it is unsafe for children or the elderly to walk on either side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkwood Road, Bexley, Greater London
